channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15404] PE: Clients in append and increment are operating serially
item.description:
On running hbase pe --nomapred increment/append 10, i see the following output where it seems like threads are executing operations serially. In the UI too, only one RS is getting requests at a time.

6/03/05 22:26:15 INFO hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Timed test starting in thread TestClient-1

16/03/05 22:26:15 INFO hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Timed test starting in thread TestClient-2

16/03/05 22:26:15 INFO hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Timed test starting in thread TestClient-8

16/03/05 22:26:15 INFO hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Timed test starting in thread TestClient-0

16/03/05 22:26:15 INFO hbase.PerformanceEvaluation: Timed test starting in thread TestClient-4

item.summary: PE: Clients in append and increment are operating serially

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I was working with 1.2.0 version, however, it may also be affecting master.
stack I think you'll know where the bug is since you worked on this recently.

Clients are still working parallely, except that they all process keys from a same small range at a time. for eg. fist 0 - 1M, then 1M - 2M, so on..
Thanks stack for explaining.
